text: Olivocochlear (OC) terminals in inner and outer hair cell (IHC and OHC) regions were analyzed quantitatively along the cochlear spiral via light-microscopic observation of cochlear wholemounts immunostained with antibodies to glutamic acid decarboxylase (GAD), vesicular acetylcholine transporter (VAT), or the peptide calcitonin gene-related peptide(CGRP) .

The results in mouse showed that (1) there are prominent gamma-aminobutyric acid(GABA) ergic, cholinergic, and calcitonin gene-related peptide(CGRP) ergic innervations in the OHC and IHC regions, (2) gamma-aminobutyric acid(GABA) and calcitonin gene-related peptide(CGRP) are extensively colocalized with acetylcholine(ACh) in all Olivocochlear(OC) terminals in the IHC and OHC areas, (3) the longitudinal gradient of Olivocochlear(OC) innervation peaks roughly at the 10-kHz region in the OHC area and is more uniform along the cochlear spiral in the IHC area, (4) in contrast to other mammalian species there is no radial gradient of Olivocochlear(OC) innervation of the OHCs, and (5) all OHC efferent terminals arise from the medial Olivocochlear(OC) system and terminals in the IHC area arise from the lateral Olivocochlear(OC) system.
